content: Task force seizes pirate ‘mother ship’ Two ships assigned to the multinational counter-piracy mission off Somalia and in the Middle East seized an alleged pirate "mother ship" on Wednesday and detained more than a dozen suspected pirates, Navy officials said Thursday. The Republic of Korea destroyer ROKS Munmu the Great and the American guided missile cruiser USS Gettysburg responded to a distress call about 3:30 p.m. local time Wednesday from the Egyptian-flagged Motor Vessel Amira. The Amira reported being attacked some 86 miles south of Al Mukalla, Yemen, said Lt. Nathan Christensen, a spokesman for U.S. Naval Forces Central Command/5th Fleet. Read full article here ... The Stars and Stripes >>>http://www.stripes.com/article.asp?section=104&article=62685

content: The task force will eventually figure out how to control this problem. I think by the years end we will see the tide turn to the good guy’s favor.

title: Task force seizes pirate ‘mother ship’

content: I think the Pirate's days of looting the high seas are coming to an end. First off there are not that many of them. Second, they will soon run out of boats and motors along with fuel for them. Lastly, countries don't care if people are killed or kidnapped, but when you take money out of their wallets, be prepared for Nuke War baby.
